Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice or heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (almost entirely lost); exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (head and wing remaining with added red on hair and wing), to right; elaborate rosettes, pendant triangle and roundel as filling ornament, some with red.
Curator's comments: Since the sherd is quite thick, it may have come from a heavy chalice
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 256, no. 459, pl. 63)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 82)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1336) (phase 2)
